page.title: 15TEKTRONIX
page.content: { Tektronix}is one of the industrial factories in Pindar Road, Hoddesdon. The site covers 6 acres. Tektronix was started by Howard Vollum in l952. It was originally called Telequipment before an American company took over in 1967. 200 people are employed. Tektronix is the sole U.K. maker of oscilloscopes which are used for accurate measuring of electricity. This equipment costs from Â£1000 upwards per sets. Tektronix sell about 6000 oscilloscopes each year. The product takes 5 days to make. The average worker earns Â£85-Â£95 per week. The factory is small compared to the one in Beaverton, Oregon in America which employs 20,000 workers. The site was formally used to make concrete slabs.
